intro: Adenopus breviflorus, commonly known as the short-flowered adenopus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, hairy fruits. Adenopus breviflorus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
